Posts.Content: May 9, 2016 11:55AM peculiargirl wrote: Our local Sam's Club has shelf bra camis - 2 in a package for $12, sizes xs (4-6) to xxl (20). I'm on the high end of that scale, and while *I* can tell I'm not wearing a "real" bra, my husband says I look fine, and it sure feels better than wearing a sports bra. My Rad techs suggested them, and I'm so glad they did. Today was #25 of 33, and I'm one of those people who haven't posted because things are going well. My skin is really red and starting to peel, and I don't do much in the evenings after radiology and working all day, but it's manageable - and NOTHING like chemo fatigue. Probably the "worst" side effect I've experienced is trouble swallowing - when I'm eating or drinking, it feels like I've taken too big a bite/drink. So it takes me twice as long to eat as anyone else at the table, but again, it's not that big a deal. My RO says it's because the rads are hitting my esophagus due to the location of the (removed) lump. This journey is getting old, but I try to focus on the end goal - radiation is lessening my chances of recurrence. Good luck to everyone- Kathy
Posts.Title: Spring 2016 Rads Moderators Sitti

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2018 12:20PM peculiargirl wrote: Hi - 2015 Stage IIIC - lumpectomy, chemo, radiation 2018 - TWO DAYS AFTER MY 2-YEAR CANCER FREE ANNIVERSARY, Stage IV, bone mets. Started radiation 4/10, today was #11 out of 20 - more than halfway done WOO-HOO!! Biopsy/kyphoplasty scheduled for Thursday, then Ibrance/Faslodex. Kathy

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2018 06:33AM peculiargirl wrote: Thanks everyone. Sorry about the "poor me" post yesterday -- it was just a bad day. Had my 2nd radiation this morning, and it went much better than yesterday. 2 down, 18 to go! :) Took a benadryl last night and finally got some sleep, which sure makes a difference! Kathy
